comments.commentBody: Restless is not the same as ill at ease. Ill at ease is an adverse emotional state, restlessness is a physical state. It has nothing to do with being ill at ease.

This is one of those themes that doesn't help to solve the puzzle, it only is amusing to see it after you are all done. For that reason I consider this an innappropriate puzzle for a Tuesday to say nothing of the obtuse and questionable clues such as 2D, 26D and 17A.

I was hoping for a picture or video of Tati.

Bust a rib? My gut feeling about that answer is . . .

And all this time I thought weiners were what you cooked on the bbq.

As I was finishing, I thought the folks at Madison Square Garden are not going to be happy with this puzzle...three ways to say, Knicks Lose, Right?  I was a little slow and guess it was quickly putting in samples for triples off of the LES ending and not thinking H. H. Munro for 31A.

Of course it's tawdry. This is a museum where you can shoot at western villains, examine medieval torture devices, and watch "dumb criminal" videos. It's all part of the growing industry of Evilness Porn.

Saab loyalists will be able to "smell" the authenticity and integrity of anything carrying the Saab marque. I wish Spyker well. I wish Tata well with Jaguar and Land Rover. I hope Volvo fares well. People inclined towards these marques will be able to differentiate the real from the "faux". I am happy Saab gets another chance as I hope the new owners respect what they have bought. It ain't metal!

Problem with a lot of Americans is that they want their freedoms and they want to ban other citizens freedoms they hate.  Guns, drugs, gambling, prostitution, topless woman in public, good dogs off leashes, gay marriage, etc need to be legalized.  The party needs to get out of our private lives and prosecute real crimes.
To #8.  EJS,Granite City: I would say, Sick. America's love affair with guns is sick.

I live in a rural county.  The sheriff (whose staff has been depleted by the budget crisis) is 30 minutes away, at best.  I am completely on my own, driving the back roads.  I hold a permit to carry a legally registered, concealed, handgun; a permit which requires training.  I would not think of leaving home without my pistol, which I am fully prepared to use to defend my life or the lives of my loved ones.  Perhaps those who live in urban areas with prompt and reliable public safety services don't need firearms, but we in the sticks sure do.  Say what you will about guns, but as long as there are bad guys out there there will be a need for an armed populace.

This is another example of gutless administration performance.  By remaining silent on this issue, as in so many others, they have enabled the other side dictate the issues and galvanize support against even the slightest hint of modest control.  When will these guys learn from the incessant defeats?  And to think I donated money, time, intellect and emotion to get Obama elected...

It takes a lot of training to fire a gun with a reasonable chance of success when defending yourself from a mugging. I was mugged at gunpoint by two guys who drove up and jumped out of their car on an empty street as I walked home at 9 pm. Instantly one guy had the gun in my stomac, a 9 mm semi automatic and the other guy frisking my pockets and jacket. If I had a gun I never could have gotten it out in time to do anything and the gun in my stomach would have been fired the moment they found the gun in my pocket. "What the *** is this" they would have said. Blam. Me dying on a street in front of my house. Instead, they got $18 and a chance to waste 10 years in jail for armed robbery. Why do all these folks out there promoting guns think they can do what cops only do after a LOT of training and even cops don't always like the the odds and they know how to react and intimidate, keys to bettering your odds in gun play, we the gun buying public don't. Go ahead, arm everyone in the country, get yourself killed for $20. Or better yet, get shot by someone you know.

Yes, there is a right to bear arms. Let me repeat that. A RIGHT, not a requirement. I do not understand why some people feel they have a gun for every day of the week. If you are afraid of someone breaking into your house, get a shotgun and be done with it. If a group breaks in, they are not going to take turns waiting to get shot.

Maybe an armed society is a polite society, but only because it is a fearful society.

And why weren't all these people speaking up when the GWBush administration insisted it could throw people into jail without charging them and it could wiretap our phones? Your gun rights are pretty useless if you do not have all your other rights.

Insisting on getting more and more guns all the time seems like a reactive mentality. These people keep preparing for the collapse of society when they could be doing something to prevent it.

I fail to see how anyone can equate so-called "gun violence" with owning a firearm legally.  Criminals that wish to use firearms in the act of committing a crime are going to do so, and it doesn't matter if firearms are legal or not.  Criminals will get weapons to use and they do not get them legally.  Why is that so hard to understand?  Personally, I can go to a range for a few hours, look around, and feel much better about the state of this country.  Do any of you really think that if the UK had the same gun laws as the USA, they would be under CCTV surveillance 24/7.  For all out flaws as a nation, we at least do a few things right.  I think that many of you forget just how this country began.  I do not wish for my family to live in a police state, and you have to be a fool not to see that things like the Patriot Act are a road-map to that location.  An armed population will insure that there will be a limit to which the population can be pushed; just like it did 250 years ago.

Statistics show that owning a gun makes it much more likely that the owner will kill themselves or a family member than a criminal.  It follows then that these laws together represent a major right wing population control measure.  I support any law that accomplishes that.

There are a whole bunch of people, stoked by right-wing radio, who actually think like the satire posted by RWRuger of Indiana (#134).  And these people are free to go out walking in public with loaded guns!

the gun obsessions in the country has gotten to the point of ridiculous.
We all know in most cases guns are a stand in for insecure men and their manhood.
It's to make them feel all macho and stuff.
For others it is simply a device to kill.
Either way, our regression on guns is symptomatic of the rest of the things that this country has been regressing on over the past decade. Rather then progress and become more civilized we regress in most areas now.
No wonder China will overtake us. We are too scared of progress and changes needed to move forward.
We'd rather pretend we are the cowboy on the open range with little education but, our guns and bible to help us thru the rough and open prairie.
Party like it's 1878.

"[Virginia] delegates voted to repeal a 17-year-old ban on buying more than one handgun a month"

Here's my explanation: years ago the New York Times published a chart & article showing that most guns used in crimes in New York City came from Virginia. I bet those Virginians who buy more than one handgun a month are reselling them to shady dealers who them sell them to criminals in New York and elsewhere.

I want to thank all of you for submitting comments and participating in this spirited discussion. Just discussing this problem is, I believe, helpful. One thing the bulk of your comments has clarified for me is that there is some real paranoia on both sides of this issue. High profile stories like that of Dr. Amy Bishop helps to drive this paranoia. It was an incredibly tragic story but the truth is that this tragedy is virtually an anomaly. The sort of thing (a Phd using a handgun to fatally shoot colleagues?) that never happens (almost!). The same can be said about the handful of tragic stories that has dominated the news over the last several years (Columbine, Virginia Tech, etc.). The news saturation leaves the impression that these events are going on everywhere all the time. Nothing could be further from the truth.

I can talk about this as someone whose life was severely challenged by a gun. This gun was used to murder my brother in 1981. True, it was not the gun that killed my brother, the criminal who used it was entirely to blame. I have never wanted anything in my life more than to respond by getting a gun and ...

I am absolutely convinced that if I chose to accquire a gun I could successfully do so. I DO NOT CHOOSE TO PURCHASE, ACQUIRED OR POSSESS A GUN. In my case, I know that it would not be wise in the long or short term.

I am amazed that there are many who are not like me. They are gun enthusiasts. One friend of mine recently told me that he is always armed. He is a law enforcement official. A significant majority of police officers go through their entire career without firing their weapons in the line of duty. Similarly, there are innumerable citizens who are responsible gun enthusiasts who are able to possess guns without it ending in inevitable tragedy.

It is also amazing that criminals have absolutely no difficulty acquiring guns. Although the law forbids it, they (criminals) are experts in activities which are illegal, and new or more restrictive gun laws are ineffectual when it comes to criminals.

Perhaps, American freedom means that each of us must personally deal with the gun proliferation problem in our country. I have decided this matter for myself. I do not believe that I must try to decide it for everyone else.

Andy #222: President Obama did NOT authorize guns in national parks. Our craven, venal Congress did that as an add-on to an unrelated bill. The people who demand untrammeled gun rights approach life with extraordinary cowardice. When did the USA turn into a nation of fearful, paranoid weaklings? Just keep on buying into the right wing talking points, guys- hate science, repudiate your community, vote republican- the disaster you fantasize will become a reality soon enough.
Which of these groups should be more afraid of, the NRA for fear mongering to boost gun sales, or the small minds that buy into it?

Of 62 listed countries the US has the 38th Worst murder rate - 37 other countries have a lower murder rate. Countries with the most gun controls have the lowest rates.
The US at 4.2 per 100,000

countries with extensive gun controls and.or no handguns allowed:
Japan : .5 per 100,000
Norway, Denmark 1 per 100,000
United Kingdom 1.4 per 100,000

France, Spain, Italy, Switzerland, ... less than 2 per 100,000
(note: these European countries have more immigrants per capital than the US - legal and illegal).

The argument that more guns results in a safer society is a bold faced lie!
Interesting that gun rights are the one liberty where conservatives and liberals reverse their usual roles. Ours is a very strange culture.
And so America, having stood at the edge of the abyss and having contemplated just how much worse things could get, decides to take the plunge anyway. (Sniff.)
What is needed is a RICO Act investigation of the NRA.

NY Times itself showed this coming weeks after the Obama inauguration with an article in Kentucky gunshops and the men there adding to their heavy supply of ammunition because Obama and his gangs were coming after them.  What gangs and from where they were never asked nor did they comment on their own unless the reporter deleted it. This is just another move in other states by other white men that fear anyone that's not exactly like they are.( There are a few of color but not in the same proportion or number.)  Obama knew of this then and most likely beforehand.  He told the President of Mexico that he had no chance in the near future to put up gun-control bills--never really clarified why other than attitudes known of all Republicans and some Democrats that if one gun is controlled the government will take away all of them.  Also with inside and outside "possibilities" of terrorist acts he didn't feel he could justify federal gun control.  If so many are backing states' rights then I hope the states also are responsible for any of the injuries or deaths their state citizens may cause by having a gun in their possession.  Open gun carrying was done last week at some meeting in San Francisco--Liberal?? and gun controlled??  Until more people--esp white poorly educated men get back to work, we are going to see a lot of this foolishness.  Did anyone see the action of the KKK in all its sheets and glory in Georgia today??  The "rats" are coming out of the cellar.  Where there is one, there are many--in groups.  Some just don't wear sheets!!!
